channel.title: Account Back= RSBot?
channel.description:
Alright so I just found out my old password for an account i used like 2 years ago which the statistics are:
Construction - 60
Prayer - 60
Combat - 13
Money(includes all items) 5m
Members Items - Yes
Runes - around 5k of each
IDK if i should use rsbot on it ot just leave it as it is
recommend me pls![br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2009, 11:49:47 pm[/size][hr]Also i'de like to say that i have 2m worth of Items on me and ya.. if i use a rsbot they will get off somehow.. so as the members item in my invo, and im not planning on paying for mem

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:13, topic:273393”]You might want to check it before you say things ;).
None of the applet parameters change on refresh.[/quote]
Of course not its a cookie.
StaticClass.Class74_Sub1_aString2826 = getParameter(“settings”);
They use this parameter in pretty much all of the open new document URLs. More importantly they set a cookie. I haven’t looked too hard but its used elsewhere and I’m pretty certain its sent to the server over the game connection.

(Some of these people also seem to think JaGEx can see the number of field counts lol. Which was some stupid discussion I had at rscheata at the beginning of RSBot :S)
They can't but they can call getDeclaredField and getDeclaredMethod on any class they like. Your interface methods would be the logical place to check but I haven't heard reports of that actually happening. That said there should be precautions and at least a way of monitoring it.

Read full topic

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

qauters they do share some information with certain people, more if they have a good reason for asking.

I have also tried getting an account reported for macroing when it wasn’t using scripts, I just stayed logged in for an hour or so - it got banned.

Read full topic

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:14, topic:273393”]You don’t get banned on login like you do with deobs, but they know it’s not a legit client. It’s because they aren’t as strict as they could be with 3rd party software for some reason. Their anti macro system is 99% automatic, and is triggered by certain things, including being reported for macroing.

In any case, as soon as it’s triggered they can see straight away you’re macroing because of it’s detectability.

I can’t remember exactly what was the cause of it, (I do remember x3 or w/e that dev’s name was accusing bash) just that there’s at least one thing that makes it detectable. I think spel mentioned something about it a while back.

The only way to avoid the ban is avoid triggering the macro detection, and avoid being reported which isn’t an easy thing to do. As soon as they take a closer look, it doesn’t matter which script you used.[/quote]
To make a few things straight:
Nobody knows (except JaGEx…) exactly how their anti-macro system works. Any assumptions you make a based on rough ideas and not on facts.
I do not agree with the fact that they aren’t strict. There is no reason why they would let you use RSBot to play legit, is there?

There are ways they might detect RSBot, but on the current information I can see. I have a strong believe that they don’t specifically detect it when not running any scripts (so no bad mouse patterns / bad scripts / bad reactions etc).

Anyway I still agree it’s possible that they do, that’s why I’m creating a bot that’s impossible to detect other then bad scripts / weird reactions.

Read full topic

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

You don’t get banned on login like you do with deobs, but they know it’s not a legit client. It’s because they aren’t as strict as they could be with 3rd party software for some reason. Their anti macro system is 99% automatic, and is triggered by certain things, including being reported for macroing.

In any case, as soon as it’s triggered they can see straight away you’re macroing because of it’s detectability.

I can’t remember exactly what was the cause of it, (I do remember x3 or w/e that dev’s name was accusing bash) just that there’s at least one thing that makes it detectable. I think spel mentioned something about it a while back.

The only way to avoid the ban is avoid triggering the macro detection, and avoid being reported which isn’t an easy thing to do. As soon as they take a closer look, it doesn’t matter which script you used.

Read full topic

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

BAsh:

It may contain all of the parameters but those parameters are constant and don’t change. Therefore they are detectable. Additionally every refresh of the RS game page changes the parameters so they stick out like a sore thumb. They built a scriptable reflection checker. They have no hurdles to check all the applet parameters.

You might want to check it before you say things ;).
None of the applet parameters change on refresh.

BAsh:

Sure you may not get banned for login. The issue is the banning later on. You don’t know what caused it and therefore you have no idea what to fix. They apply this philosophy in WoW. I think they assume that anyone who logs in with a deob is an idiot and should be banned for their ignorance.

Obviously, that’s one of the reasons I made QBot. But if you compare RSBot with the time of Aryan (later on), you will see a lot less bans unless people bot to much.
So that gives me a valid reason to believe RSBot is less detectable then some people assume.
(Some of these people also seem to think JaGEx can see the number of field counts lol. Which was some stupid discussion I had at rscheata at the beginning of RSBot :S)

BAsh:

Bad scripts and reports? Maybe. It would provide a great filter to crack down on where gamers think botters are affecting them the most and so the banning of those bots would target the most profitable and also the most PR generating outcome per ban.

Any resource gaining activity is bad for players because it provides less for them. You will see less people banned for fletching then for mining.
Also JaGEx seem to check more on money gaining activities like plank making.

BAsh:

This discussion should be on rsbot.org but this thread was posted here and it is relevant to this thread. In addition you are highly unlikely to get intelligent discussion from rsbot.org. At least here you get a few gems of wisdom in between the faggotory, flaming and banning.

That was mainly pointed at twins and the original discussion of this thread. Whom was happily to provide us another useless post -.-

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

It may contain all of the parameters but those parameters are constant and don’t change. Therefore they are detectable. Additionally every refresh of the RS game page changes the parameters so they stick out like a sore thumb. They built a scriptable reflection checker. They have no hurdles to check all the applet parameters.

Sure you may not get banned for login. The issue is the banning later on. You don’t know what caused it and therefore you have no idea what to fix. They apply this philosophy in WoW. I think they assume that anyone who logs in with a deob is an idiot and should be banned for their ignorance.

Bad scripts and reports? Maybe. It would provide a great filter to crack down on where gamers think botters are affecting them the most and so the banning of those bots would target the most profitable and also the most PR generating outcome per ban.

This discussion should be on rsbot.org but this thread was posted here and it is relevant to this thread. In addition you are highly unlikely to get intelligent discussion from rsbot.org. At least here you get a few gems of wisdom in between the faggotory, flaming and banning.

Read full topic

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:9, topic:273393”][quote author=Tenac link=topic=361298.msg2750124#msg2750124 date=1239851773]

rsbot itself is detectable on login

I’d love to hear some proof of why you think this and what you think causes it… Otherwise that just sounds like a false rumor floating around to me.
[/quote]
Actually its true. At the very least they don’t parse the applet parameters.[/quote]
What? It contains all needed applet parameters in the BotStub. There’s no need to parse it from the site really.

I never got banned for using RSBot for being logged in, which is something you will when using a deob.
Therefor I can say RSBot might be detectable (if they wanted too), but they don’t really do it.

What they do detect are bad scripts and they heavily rely on reports.

Anyway this kind of discussion shouldn’t be here really, but should be posted on rsbot.org instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @Registered_User Registered User
item.description:
@Registered_User wrote:

There’s no such thing as an unbanable script. There’s too many factors involved in whether you’re selected to be banned or not. If you 100% don’t want to be banned, then cheating is not for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?

never botted on this account, but i want to know what scripts are 100 or 99% unbanable.

item.title: Account Back= RSBot?
item.dc:creator: @Registered_User Registered User
item.description:
@Registered_User wrote:

This kind of question doesn’t really belong in this section but I can see why you’ve posted it here. If the account has no prior macroing offenses, go ahead and bot it after upgrading it to members (members get a 10day temp ban before perm ban, nonmembers get permed 1st offense) Once you get temp banned (never happens to some people, depends on how smart you are about botting) you’re done botting on that account or you risk being perm banned.

Read full topic
